newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia sticks to grain crop forecast of 70 mln T.
newsitem.headline: Russia sticks to grain crop forecast of 70 mln T.

text.p: MOSCOW, June 23 (Moscow) - Russian agriculture ministry officials, sticking to previous forecasts, said on Monday net grain output would be at least 70 million tonnes this year.
Ministry specialists, quoted by the official Itar-Tass news agency, said crops were developing well, except in Western and Eastern Siberia, where moisture levels were below normal.
Tass said the grain belt regions of Krasnodar and Stavropol would have high yields and could increase output by 50 percent over 1996.
Russia's net grain output last year was a mediocre 69.3 million tonnes, the second worst on record in three decades after 1995's very poor 63.4 million tonnes.

Farmers increased wheat plantings this year at the expense of feed grain sowings. Russia's imports of wheat and wheat flour soared last year, but feed grain imports have not taken off due to declining livestock numbers.
